meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of an amoeba.
meanings.sent1: The single-celled organism showed an amoeban behavior by constantly changing its shape.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the amoeban characteristics of the microscopic creature.
meanings.sent3: The playful children pretended to move in an amoeban way, imitating the tiny organism.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed in an unpredictable, ever-changing, amoeban pattern.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of an amoeban structure in her abstract painting.

meanings.definition: Resembling an amoeba in shape or movement.
meanings.sent1: The jellyfish had an amoeban appearance, with its fluid shape and slow movements.
meanings.sent2: The robot's design was inspired by the amoeban motion of simple organisms.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's graceful and fluid movements on stage were described as almost amoeban.
meanings.sent4: The city's layout seemed to expand and contract in an amoeban manner, adapting to the needs of its inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: The clouds in the sky drifted lazily, forming an ever-changing, amoeban silhouette.
